course_title: Topics in German Studies: Creative Writing auf Deutsch
class_notes: In this course, you will learn about the characteristics of popular short-form literary genres; such as: aphorisms, poems, fables, the short story, and entries in a travelogue, to gain a deeper understanding of German literary culture and begin producing your own creative literary texts in German. Preparation for class sessions will require either a short reading assignment of 3-5 pages or the completion of a short writing assignment (1-2 pages), which will then be workshopped during class. As a course capstone, students will revise and potentially expand one of their assignments and present it at a public reading at the end of the semester.
course_description: Taught in German. An interdisciplinary course intended to provide in-depth study of formative elements, influences, and movements in German-speaking culture(s). May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
